name: Implementing Blocklists on Permissionless Blockchains
description: Hodlon speaks about the concepts of exclusion lists, and how the proof of innocence systems that use them help maintain user privacy. He also speaks to the challenges these systems face to being adopted, and what it means to consider the implementation of exclusion lists on a borderless, decentralized and ostensibly neutral blockchain. Finally, he introduces Exlist, a project aimed at tackling the challenges of maintaining reputable, up-to-date exclusion list data.

speakers.name: Hodlon
speakers.bio: Hodlon is a web3 buidler with experience launching new products, scaling teams and engaging with online and IRL communities. He has held Product Management and Quality Assurance Management roles at a major crypto exchange. His current focus is on Exlist, an onchain exclusion list database that maintains blocklists for Proof of Innocence applications in a decentralized manner.
